q: management shake-up. Current Google CEO Eric Schmidt will serve as the company's executive chairman. Co-founder Sergey Brin will devote his time to strategic projects, in particular working on new products, the company said. We've been talking about how best to simplify our management structure and speed up decision making for a long time, Mr Eric Schmidt said in a statement.`` By clarifying our individual roles we'll create clearer responsibility and accountability at the top of the company. We elected a human being, Barack Obama .`` I think he has reached out to countries around the world and has developed good relations with countries around the world,'' Colin Powell said. And I think he's working very hard on the issue of unemployment which I think is the major problem facing America right now, and I think and I hope that this will be the centerpiece of the State of the Union speech. My argument to them is why not let states experiment? So it is a state's rights argument, Welch said. Sen. Bernie Sanders added that the date change wouldn't cost the federal government anything extra, doesn't mention the word singlepayer but would hold states to all the requirements of the law.

Eric Schmidt 's departure had been a long time coming, says Charles Arthur in The Guardian: After slipups with search, Street View and Android, it's clear that Google needs tighter control at the top- and Eric Schmidt is not the man for the job. What of Google's other co-founder, Sergey Brin ? He is said to be focusing on strategic projects and is particularly interested in social networking.
